If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

50.7.2. Attempt to modify activated Flight 1 in conflict test step

50.7.2.1. Attempt to modify Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied modification because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See modify_activated_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

50.7.2.1.1. üõë Incorrectly modified check

If the USS successfully modifies the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in modifying the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.718426Z)

50.7.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to modify Flight 1 so that it becomes in conflict with Flight 2. Both flights are activated at that point. However, because the conflict did not exist when the modification was initiated, it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030. In addition, Flight 1 should not have been removed, because doing so would leave an aircraft in flight without any flight plan.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.718393Z)

50.7.2.2. Validate Flight 1 not modified

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

50.7.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:27.677880Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:27.723737Z)

50.7.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Because the modification attempt was invalid, Flight 1 should not have been modified.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.723785Z)

50.8. Cleanup

50.8.1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Successful flight deletion check

interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.756685Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.787076Z)

51. [S46] Nominal planning: conflict with higher priority

51.1. Description

This test aims to test the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the prioritization scenarios where there exists a conflict with a higher priority flight:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0015
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0020
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0025
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030

It involves a tested USS and a control USS through which conflicting flights are injected.

It assumes that the area used in the scenario is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario).

51.2. Resources

51.2.1. flight_intents

FlightIntentsResource that provides the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Priority State Must conflict with Must not conflict with
flight1_planned Flight 1 Any Accepted Flight 2 Flight 2m
flight1_activated Activated
flight1m_planned Flight 1m Accepted Flight 2 N/A
flight1m_activated Activated
flight1c_activated Flight 1c Activated Flight 2m N/A
flight2_planned Flight 2 Higher than Flight 1* Accepted Flight 1 N/A
flight2_activated Activated
flight2m_activated Flight 2m Activated Flight 1c Flight 1

Because the scenario involves activation of intents, the start times of all activated intents must be during the time the test scenario is executed (not before). Additionally, their end times must leave sufficient time for the execution of the test scenario.

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

51.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 1.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 1 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

51.2.3. control_uss

FlightPlannerResource that will manage conflicting Flight 2.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

51.2.4. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where flight creation/sharing can be verified.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

51.3. Attempt to plan flight in conflict test case

51.3.1. Plan Flight 2 test step

51.3.1.1. Plan Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

51.3.1.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.837510Z)

51.3.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The higher priority flight should be successfully planned by the control USS as there are no other flights in the area yet.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.837480Z)

51.3.1.2. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

51.3.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:27.794253Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:27.842890Z)

51.3.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.842941Z)

51.3.1.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.3.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.842980Z)

51.3.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.854929Z)

51.3.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.863720Z)

51.3.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.864743Z)

51.3.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.864780Z)

51.3.1.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.864803Z)

51.3.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.3.2. Attempt to plan Flight 1 test step

51.3.2.1. Attempt to plan Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied planning because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See plan_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

51.3.2.1.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

If the USS successfully plans the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in creating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0015.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.910354Z)

51.3.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to plan the Flight 1 via the tested USS. However, it conflicts with Flight 2, which is of higher priority. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0015.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.910322Z)

51.3.2.2. Validate Flight 1 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

51.3.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:27.872270Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:27.915529Z)

51.3.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.915577Z)

51.3.3. Delete Flight 2 test step

This page describes the content of a common test case where a flight intent should be successfully deleted by a flight planner. See delete_flight in test_steps.py.

51.3.3.1. üõë Successful deletion check

The flight ID provided is correct and corresponds to an existing flight intent, therefore it should have been deleted by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a failure, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:27.945994Z)

51.4.2. Plan Flight 2 test step

51.4.2.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve pre-existing notifications check

Just before directing the planning activity, the test director observes pre-existing notifications which cannot relate to the planning activity that has not yet happened. If these notifications cannot be retrieved, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.056638Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.069528Z)

51.4.3. Check for conflict notifications test step

The test director checks whether a notification reporting the creation of a conflict by Flight 2 was sent to UAS personnel for the control_uss.

The test director also checks whether a notification reporting the creation of a new conflict with Flight 1 was sent to the UAS personnel for the tested_uss managing Flight 1.

Note that these actions will not be performed if the test director was unable to retrieve the notifications before the planning activity.

51.4.3.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve notifications check

We fetch the list of notifications. If the USS doesn't return a valid answer, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI and we cannot proceed with notification tests.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.211240Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.225176Z)

51.4.4. Attempt to modify planned Flight 1 in conflict test step

51.4.4.1. Attempt to modify Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied modification because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See modify_planned_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

51.4.4.1.1. üõë Incorrectly modified check

If the USS successfully modifies the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in modifying the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0020.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.290168Z)

51.4.4.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to modify Flight 1 via the tested USS, which is planned. However, it conflicts with Flight 2, which is of higher priority and was planned in the meantime. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0020.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.290135Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.318508Z)

51.4.4.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.319510Z)

51.4.4.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.319547Z)

51.4.4.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.319570Z)

51.4.4.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. Because the modification attempt was invalid, either Flight 1 should not have been modified (because the USS kept the original accepted request), or it should have been removed (because the USS rejected the replacement plan provided).

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.5. Attempt to activate flight in conflict test case

51.5.1. Attempt to activate conflicting Flight 1 test step

51.5.1.1. Attempt to activate Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied activation because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See activate_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

51.5.1.1.1. üõë Incorrectly activated check

If the USS successfully activates the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in activating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.382914Z)

51.5.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to activate Flight 1, however, it conflicts with Flight 2, which is also planned and of higher priority. Note that Flight 1 could be either planned or non-existent before this step. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.382855Z)

51.5.1.2. Validate Flight 1 not activated

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

51.5.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:28.329614Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:28.390408Z)

51.5.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.390500Z)

51.5.1.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.5.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.390554Z)

51.5.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.406791Z)

51.5.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.415897Z)

51.5.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.416900Z)

51.5.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.416938Z)

51.5.1.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.416961Z)

51.5.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. Because the modification attempt was invalid, either Flight 1 should not have been modified (because the USS kept the original accepted request), or it should have been removed (because the USS rejected the replacement plan provided).

The flight ID provided is correct and corresponds to an existing flight intent, therefore it should have been deleted by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a failure, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.456226Z)

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

51.6.2.1.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.540196Z)

51.6.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver activates Flight 1, which should be done successfully given that it is now the highest-priority flight. Note that Flight 1 could be either planned or non-existent before this step. In the latter case, the flight will be directly activated without being planned beforehand.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.540162Z)

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

51.6.3.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.691173Z)

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The second flight should be successfully planned by the control USS.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.691130Z)

51.6.4. Activate Flight 2 test step

51.6.4.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve pre-existing notifications check

Just before directing the planning activity, the test director observes pre-existing notifications which cannot relate to the planning activity that has not yet happened. If these notifications cannot be retrieved, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.733416Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.747052Z)

51.6.4.2. Activate Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

51.6.4.2.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.875670Z)

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver activates Flight 2, which should be done successfully given that it is the highest-priority flight.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.875639Z)

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.6.5. Check for conflict notifications test step

The test director checks whether a notification reporting the modification of Flight 2 while in conflict was sent to UAS personnel for the control_uss.

The test director also checks whether a notification reporting the modification of a flight conflicting with Flight 1 was sent to the UAS personnel for the tested_uss managing Flight 1.

Note that these actions will not be performed if the test director was unable to retrieve the notifications before the planning activity.

51.6.5.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve notifications check

We fetch the list of notifications. If the USS doesn't return a valid answer, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI and we cannot proceed with notification tests.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.920540Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:28.934345Z)

51.6.6. Modify activated Flight 1 in conflict with activated Flight 2 test step

51.6.6.1. Modify Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent in activated state is tentatively modified by a flight planned. Multiple outcomes may be valid. See modify_activated_flight in test_steps.py.

51.6.6.1.1. üõë Successful modification check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid. The (already activated) provided flight intent may be in conflict with another activated flight, but only if this conflict already existed before the modification was initiated.

If the provided flight intent is not in conflict with another intent the USS should have successfully modified the flight per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030. If the USS fails to modify the flight, wrongly indicates a conflict, or wrongly indicates the activated state of the flight, this check will fail.

If the provided flight intent is in conflict with another intent and that a pre-existing conflict was present, the USS may have decided to be more conservative and to not support modification. In such case, the USS may indicate that the operation is not supported instead of modifying the flight per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030. If the USS fails to modify the flight, or fails to indicate that the modification is not supported, or wrongly indicates the activated state of the flight, this check will fail.

Do take note that if the USS rejects the modification when a pre-existing conflict was present, this check will not fail, but the following Rejected modification check will. Refer to this check for more information.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.058071Z)

51.6.6.1.2. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Rejected modification check

If the provided flight intent is in conflict with another intent and that a pre-existing conflict was present, the USS may have rejected the modification instead of modifying it or indicating that the modification is not supported. This could be the case for example if the USS does not support directly update of intents and instead delete the previous one and create a new one. This may or may not be strictly speaking a failure to meet a requirement, but we cannot distinguish between an actual failure to meet the requirement and a reasonable behavior due to implementation limitations.

As such, if the pre-existing conflict was present, and that the USS rejected the modification, this check will produce a low severity finding per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.058131Z)

51.6.6.1.3. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Before execution of this step, flights 1 and 2 are activated and in conflict. Flight 2 is the highest-priority flight. The test driver attempts to modify Flight 1 in a way that still conflicts with Flight 2.

The successful outcomes of the modification attempts:

  1. Even though Flight 2 is the highest-priority flight, because the conflict existed before the modification was initiated, an accepted modification is considered a success per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030.
  2. Due to the conflict, the USS may decide to be more conservative and to not support the modification. This is considered a success as there is no positive requirement for the USS to accept the modification.

A rejected modification will indicate a low severity failure. Indeed, in some situations a rejection may not be strictly speaking a failure to meet a requirement. This could be the case for example if the USS does not support directly update of intents and instead delete the previous one and create a new one. Since we cannot distinguish between an actual failure to meet the requirement and a reasonable behavior due to implementation limitations, we indicate a low severity failure which won't actually fail the test.

In any case, whatever is the outcome of this step, there should not be any impact on the rest of the execution of the scenario. An intent should exist (this is checked in the next step) and it should be either the previous or the modified intent, both of which make no difference in the next steps.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.058039Z)

51.6.6.2. Validate Flight 1 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

51.6.6.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:28.944761Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.064072Z)

51.6.6.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.064188Z)

51.6.6.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.064169Z)

51.6.6.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.064221Z)

51.6.6.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.079192Z)

51.6.6.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.088186Z)

51.6.6.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.089222Z)

51.6.6.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.089265Z)

51.6.6.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.089289Z)

51.6.6.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. If the modification was accepted, Flight 1 should have been modified. If the modification was not supported, Flight 1 should not have been modified. If the modification was rejected, Flight 1 should not have been modified and should still exist. If it does not exist, it means that there is an active flight without an operational intent, which is a failure to meet interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.7. Attempt to modify activated flight in conflict test case

51.7.1. Modify activated Flight 2 to not conflict with activated Flight 1 test step

51.7.1.1. Modify Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent in planned state should be successfully modified by a flight planner. See modify_planned_flight in test_steps.py.

51.7.1.1.1. üõë Successful modification check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been modified by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS fails to modify the flight, wrongly indicates a conflict, or wrongly indicates the planned state of the flight, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.204176Z)

51.7.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver modifies (activated) Flight 2 with the control USS so that it is not anymore in conflict with (activated) flight of test USS. As Flight 2 is of higher priority, this should succeed and leave Flight 1 clear of conflict.

If flight modification is not supported by the USS, the next test step is going to be skipped and the test case will end here.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.204135Z)

51.7.1.2. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

51.7.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.098060Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.210331Z)

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.221975Z)

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.231218Z)

51.7.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.232203Z)

51.7.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.232267Z)

51.7.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

51.7.2. Attempt to modify activated Flight 1 in conflict test step

51.7.2.1. Attempt to modify Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied modification because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See modify_activated_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

51.7.2.1.1. üõë Incorrectly modified check

If the USS successfully modifies the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in modifying the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.306246Z)

51.7.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to modify Flight 1 so that it becomes in conflict with Flight 2. Both flights are activated at that point. However, because the conflict did not exist when the modification was initiated, it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030. In addition, Flight 1 should not have been removed, because doing so would leave an aircraft in flight without any flight plan.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.306200Z)

51.7.2.2. Validate Flight 1 not modified

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

51.7.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.242267Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.312800Z)

51.7.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Because the modification attempt was invalid, Flight 1 should not have been modified.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.312859Z)

51.8. Cleanup

51.8.1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Successful flight deletion check

interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.354000Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.388302Z)

52. [S47] Nominal planning: conflict with higher priority

52.1. Description

This test aims to test the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the prioritization scenarios where there exists a conflict with a higher priority flight:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0015
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0020
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0025
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0030

It involves a tested USS and a control USS through which conflicting flights are injected.

It assumes that the area used in the scenario is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario).

52.2. Resources

52.2.1. flight_intents

FlightIntentsResource that provides the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Priority State Must conflict with Must not conflict with
flight1_planned Flight 1 Any Accepted Flight 2 Flight 2m
flight1_activated Activated
flight1m_planned Flight 1m Accepted Flight 2 N/A
flight1m_activated Activated
flight1c_activated Flight 1c Activated Flight 2m N/A
flight2_planned Flight 2 Higher than Flight 1* Accepted Flight 1 N/A
flight2_activated Activated
flight2m_activated Flight 2m Activated Flight 1c Flight 1

Because the scenario involves activation of intents, the start times of all activated intents must be during the time the test scenario is executed (not before). Additionally, their end times must leave sufficient time for the execution of the test scenario.

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

52.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 1.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

52.2.3. control_uss

FlightPlannerResource that will manage conflicting Flight 2.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 1 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

52.2.4. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where flight creation/sharing can be verified.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

52.3. Attempt to plan flight in conflict test case

52.3.1. Plan Flight 2 test step

52.3.1.1. Plan Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

52.3.1.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.467318Z)

52.3.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The higher priority flight should be successfully planned by the control USS as there are no other flights in the area yet.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.467285Z)

52.3.1.2. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.396300Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.472596Z)

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

52.3.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.472637Z)

52.3.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.488612Z)

52.3.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.497344Z)

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.498422Z)

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.498446Z)

52.3.2. Attempt to plan Flight 1 test step

52.3.2.1. Attempt to plan Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied planning because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See plan_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

52.3.2.1.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

If the USS successfully plans the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in creating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0015.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.551007Z)

52.3.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to plan the Flight 1 via the tested USS. However, it conflicts with Flight 2, which is of higher priority. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0015.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.550977Z)

52.3.2.2. Validate Flight 1 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

52.3.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.505959Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.556027Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.556071Z)

52.3.3.1. üõë Successful deletion check

The flight ID provided is correct and corresponds to an existing flight intent, therefore it should have been deleted by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a failure, this check will fail.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.4.2. Plan Flight 2 test step

52.4.2.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve pre-existing notifications check

Just before directing the planning activity, the test director observes pre-existing notifications which cannot relate to the planning activity that has not yet happened. If these notifications cannot be retrieved, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.700806Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.713668Z)

52.4.2.2. Plan Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

52.4.2.2.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.826634Z)

52.4.2.2.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The second flight should be successfully planned by the control USS. It conflicts with Flight 1, but it has higher priority.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.826602Z)

52.4.2.3. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

52.4.2.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.721186Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.832409Z)

52.4.2.3.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.832466Z)

52.4.2.3.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.4.2.3.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.832507Z)

52.4.2.3.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.848984Z)

52.4.2.3.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.858155Z)

52.4.2.3.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.859204Z)

52.4.2.3.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.859247Z)

52.4.2.3.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.859271Z)

52.4.2.3.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.4.3. Check for conflict notifications test step

The test director checks whether a notification reporting the creation of a conflict by Flight 2 was sent to UAS personnel for the control_uss.

The test director also checks whether a notification reporting the creation of a new conflict with Flight 1 was sent to the UAS personnel for the tested_uss managing Flight 1.

Note that these actions will not be performed if the test director was unable to retrieve the notifications before the planning activity.

52.4.3.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve notifications check

We fetch the list of notifications. If the USS doesn't return a valid answer, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI and we cannot proceed with notification tests.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.876196Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.889035Z)

52.4.4. Attempt to modify planned Flight 1 in conflict test step

52.4.4.1. Attempt to modify Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied modification because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See modify_planned_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

52.4.4.1.1. üõë Incorrectly modified check

If the USS successfully modifies the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in modifying the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0020.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.957194Z)

52.4.4.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to modify Flight 1 via the tested USS, which is planned. However, it conflicts with Flight 2, which is of higher priority and was planned in the meantime. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0020.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.957159Z)

52.4.4.2. Validate Flight 1 not modified

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

52.4.4.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.899386Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.963213Z)

52.4.4.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.963282Z)

52.4.4.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.4.4.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.963318Z)

52.4.4.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.977103Z)

52.4.4.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.986574Z)

52.4.4.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.987609Z)

52.4.4.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.987648Z)

52.4.4.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:29.987673Z)

52.4.4.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. Because the modification attempt was invalid, either Flight 1 should not have been modified (because the USS kept the original accepted request), or it should have been removed (because the USS rejected the replacement plan provided).

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.5. Attempt to activate flight in conflict test case

52.5.1. Attempt to activate conflicting Flight 1 test step

52.5.1.1. Attempt to activate Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied activation because of a conflict with a higher priority flight intent. See activate_priority_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

52.5.1.1.1. üõë Incorrectly activated check

If the USS successfully activates the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in activating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.042728Z)

52.5.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to activate Flight 1, however, it conflicts with Flight 2, which is also planned and of higher priority. Note that Flight 1 could be either planned or non-existent before this step. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.042696Z)

52.5.1.2. Validate Flight 1 not activated

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

52.5.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:29.997408Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.048876Z)

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.5.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.048913Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.062865Z)

52.5.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.072639Z)

52.5.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.072671Z)

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.072695Z)

52.5.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. Because the modification attempt was invalid, either Flight 1 should not have been modified (because the USS kept the original accepted request), or it should have been removed (because the USS rejected the replacement plan provided).

52.6. Modify activated flight with pre-existing conflict test case

52.6.1. Delete Flight 2 test step

This page describes the content of a common test case where a flight intent should be successfully deleted by a flight planner. See delete_flight in test_steps.py.

52.6.1.1. üõë Successful deletion check

The flight ID provided is correct and corresponds to an existing flight intent, therefore it should have been deleted by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a failure, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.116384Z)

52.6.2. Activate Flight 1 test step

52.6.2.1. Activate Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

52.6.2.1.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.207626Z)

52.6.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver activates Flight 1, which should be done successfully given that it is now the highest-priority flight. Note that Flight 1 could be either planned or non-existent before this step. In the latter case, the flight will be directly activated without being planned beforehand.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.207592Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.385868Z)

52.6.3.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.385902Z)

52.6.3.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

52.6.4. Activate Flight 2 test step

52.6.4.1. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Retrieve pre-existing notifications check

Just before directing the planning activity, the test director observes pre-existing notifications which cannot relate to the planning activity that has not yet happened. If these notifications cannot be retrieved, the USS has not fully implemented interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ImplementAPI.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.402575Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.417890Z)

52.6.4.2. Activate Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

52.6.4.2.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.535137Z)

52.6.4.2.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver activates Flight 2, which should be done successfully given that it is the highest-priority flight.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.535071Z)

52.6.4.3. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

52.6.4.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:30.425970Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:30.541063Z)

52.6.4.3.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.541180Z)

52.6.4.3.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.541160Z)

52.6.4.3.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.541212Z)

52.6.4.3.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.556621Z)

52.6.4.3.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.566012Z)

52.6.4.3.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.567024Z)

52.6.4.3.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:30.567063Z)
