If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.222488Z)

55.8.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.222539Z)

55.8.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.245520Z)

55.8.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.257676Z)

55.8.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.259432Z)

55.8.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.259473Z)

55.8.1.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.259498Z)

55.8.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.2. Plan Flight 2m test step

55.8.2.1. Plan Flight 2m

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

55.8.2.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.386490Z)

55.8.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The smaller Flight 2 form should be successfully planned by the control USS because it does not conflict with Flight 1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.386451Z)

55.8.2.2. Validate Flight 2m sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

55.8.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.266788Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.391711Z)

55.8.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.391779Z)

55.8.2.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.2.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.391827Z)

55.8.2.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.414160Z)

55.8.2.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.424809Z)

55.8.2.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.426306Z)

55.8.2.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.426361Z)

55.8.2.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.426404Z)

55.8.2.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3. Declare Flight 2 non-conforming test step

The test driver instructs the control USS to declare Flight 2 as non-conforming. This makes non-conforming Flight 2 conflict with activated Flight 1 -- this same-priority conflict would not be allowed if Flight 2 were in a nominal state.

Do note that executing this test step requires the control USS to support the CMSA role. As such, if the USS rejects the transition to non-conforming state, it will be assumed that the control USS does not support this role and the test execution will stop without failing.

55.8.3.1. üõë Successful transition to non-conforming state check

All flight intent data provided is correct, therefore it should have been transitioned to non-conforming state by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS rejects the transition, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the operation is not supported, the USS does not support the CMSA role, and as such the scenario execution will stop without failing.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.473071Z)

55.8.3.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.473026Z)

55.8.3.3. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

55.8.3.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.439116Z)

55.8.3.3.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.3.3.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

55.8.4. Attempt to modify activated Flight 1 in conflict with nonconforming Flight 2 test step

‚àÖ This test step was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

Before execution of this step, Flight 1 is activated (onto time range A) and Flight 2 is non-conforming (onto time range A), and both are in conflict. The test driver modifies Flight 1 in a way that still conflicts with Flight 2 by extending its time range A. This modification results in a conflict between the two equal priority flights that already existed before the modification was initiated. While this modification is expected to be accepted by the tested USS in general, the rejection of the modification does not constitute a violation of a requirement. However, the modification request must not result in a failure per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Nor should Flight 1 have been removed, because doing so would leave an aircraft in flight without any flight plan.

55.8.4.1. üõë Successful flight intent handling check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have either:

  • successfully modified the flight; or
  • properly rejected the modification; or
  • indicated that it does not support modification per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. In any other case, this check will fail.
55.8.4.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

55.8.4.3. Validate Flight 1 sharing if USS accepted its modification

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

55.8.4.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

55.8.4.3.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

55.8.4.3.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

55.8.4.3.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

55.8.4.3.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

55.8.4.3.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

55.8.4.3.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

55.8.4.3.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

55.8.4.3.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

55.8.4.3.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. This step validates that the response of the USS is consistent with the flight shared if the USS accepted the modification, i.e. whether Flight 1 was properly modified.

55.8.4.4. Validate Flight 1 not modified if USS rejected its modification

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

55.8.4.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

55.8.4.4.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. This step validates that the response of the USS is consistent with the flight shared if the USS rejected the modification, i.e. whether Flight 1 was not modified.

55.9. Cleanup

55.9.1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Successful flight deletion check

interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.527915Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.576814Z)

56. [S51] Nominal planning: not permitted conflict with equal priority

56.1. Description

This test aims at testing the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the prioritization scenarios where there exists a conflict with an equal priority flight that is not permitted by regulation:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0035
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0040
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0045
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0050

It involves a tested USS and a control USS through which conflicting flights are injected.

This scenario skips execution and completes successfully at the setup case if a resource containing equal priority flight intents where conflicts are not allow is not provided, such as if a jurisdiction does not have any priority levels at which conflicts are not allowed.

It assumes that the area used in the scenario is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario).

56.2. Resources

56.2.1. flight_intents

If the jurisdiction in which these tests are being conducted does not have a priority level at which conflicts are not allowed, the FlightIntentsResource must be None to prevent the execution of this test.

Otherwise, the FlightIntentsResource must provide the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Priority State Must conflict with Must not conflict with
flight1_planned Flight 1 Any (but all the same) Accepted Flight 2 N/A
flight1_activated Activated
flight1m_activated Flight 1m Activated Flight 2 N/A
flight1c_planned Flight 1c Planned N/A Flight 2
flight1c_activated Activated
equal_prio_flight2m_planned Flight 2m Planned N/A Flight 1
equal_prio_flight2_planned Flight 2 Flight 1, Flight 1m Flight 1c
equal_prio_flight2_activated Activated
equal_prio_flight2_nonconforming Nonconforming

Because the scenario involves activation of intents, the start times of all activated intents must be during the time the test scenario is executed (not before). Additionally, their end times must leave sufficient time for the execution of the test scenario.

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

56.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 1 and its variants.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

56.2.3. control_uss

FlightPlannerResource that will be used to inject conflicting Flight 2. Note that this control USS needs to support the CMSA role in order to transition to the Nonconforming state in order to create a pre-existing conflict among equal-priority operational intents.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 1 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

56.2.4. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where flight creation/sharing can be verified.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

56.3. Prerequisites check test case

56.3.1. Verify area is clear test step

uss_qualifier verifies with the DSS that there are no operational intents remaining in the area.

56.3.1.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, or fails to allow the deletion of an operational intent from its own creator, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.582554Z)

56.3.1.2. üõë Area is clear of op intents check

If operational intents exist in the 4D area(s) that should be clear, then the current state of the test environment is not suitable to conduct tests so this check will fail.

While this scenario assumes that the area used is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario) in order to avoid a large number of area-clearing operations, the scenario will not proceed correctly if the area was left in a dirty state following a previous scenario that was supposed to leave the area clear. This test step verifies that the area is clear.

‚úÖ (2026-02-12T10:53:36.582644Z)

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

56.4.2. Activate Flight 2 test step

56.4.2.1. Activate Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

56.4.2.1.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.890866Z)

56.4.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 2 should be successfully activated by the control USS.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.890825Z)

56.4.2.2. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.4.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.761129Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.896175Z)

56.4.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.896315Z)

56.4.2.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.896281Z)

56.4.2.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.896371Z)

56.4.2.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.922393Z)

56.4.2.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.935979Z)

56.4.2.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.937793Z)

56.4.2.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.937847Z)

56.4.2.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:36.937893Z)

56.4.2.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

56.4.3. Attempt to plan Flight 1 test step

56.4.3.1. Attempt to plan Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied planning because of a non-permitted conflict with an equal priority flight intent. See plan_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

56.4.3.1.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

If the USS successfully plans the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in creating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0035.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.015041Z)

56.4.3.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to plan the Flight 1 via the tested USS. However, it conflicts with Flight 2 which is of equal priority but came first. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0035.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.015009Z)

56.4.3.2. Validate Flight 1 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.4.3.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:36.947560Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.021047Z)

56.4.3.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 1 should not have been shared with the interoperability ecosystem since it was rejected.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.021127Z)

56.5. Attempt to activate flight into conflict test case

56.5.1. Attempt to directly activate conflicting Flight 1 test step

56.5.1.1. Attempt to activate Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied activation because of a non-permitted conflict with an equal priority flight intent. See activate_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

56.5.1.1.1. üõë Incorrectly activated check

If the USS successfully activates the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in creating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0045.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.076930Z)

56.5.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to activate directly Flight 1, i.e. without the flight being planned before. However, this conflicts with activated Flight 2, which is of equal priority. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0045.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.076898Z)

56.5.1.2. Validate Flight 1 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.5.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.028718Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.082271Z)

56.5.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 1 should not have been shared with the interoperability ecosystem since it was rejected.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.082322Z)

56.6. Attempt to modify planned flight into conflict test case

56.6.1. Plan Flight 1c test step

56.6.1.1. Plan Flight 1c

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

56.6.1.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.194628Z)

56.6.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The smaller Flight 1c form (which doesn't conflict with Flight 2) should be successfully planned by the tested USS.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.194597Z)

56.6.1.2. ‚ö†Ô∏è Validate tested USS intersection algorithm check

Because Flight 2 is nearby Flight 1c, successful planning of Flight 1c indicates the tested USS is complying with the portion of astm.f3548.v21.GEN0500 that requires a USS to indicate two 4D volumes are non-intersecting when they are separated by more than 1 cm.

This check is not relevant if the planning is rejected.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.194658Z)

56.6.1.3. Validate Flight 1c sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.6.1.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.089515Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.200407Z)

56.6.1.3.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.200460Z)

56.6.1.3.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

56.6.1.3.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.200500Z)

56.6.1.3.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.218328Z)

56.6.1.3.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.227255Z)

56.6.1.3.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.228292Z)

56.6.1.3.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.228331Z)

56.6.1.3.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.228354Z)

56.6.1.3.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

56.6.2. Attempt to modify planned Flight 1c into conflict test step

56.6.2.1. Attempt to modify Flight 1c

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied modification because of a non-permitted conflict with an equal priority flight intent. See modify_planned_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

56.6.2.1.1. üõë Incorrectly modified check

If the USS successfully modifies the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in modifying the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0040.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.297127Z)

56.6.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to enlarge Flight 1c so that it conflicts with Flight 2. However, Flight 2 is of equal priority but was planned first. As such the change to Flight 1c should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0040.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.297058Z)

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.238700Z)

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.305074Z)

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

56.6.2.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.305161Z)

56.6.2.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.322519Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.333472Z)

56.6.2.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.334611Z)

56.6.2.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.334652Z)

56.6.2.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.334676Z)

56.6.2.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. Because the modification attempt was invalid, either Flight 1c should not have been modified (because the USS kept the original accepted request), or it should have been removed (because the USS rejected the replacement plan provided).

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

56.7. Attempt to modify activated flight into conflict test case

56.7.1. Activate Flight 1c test step

56.7.1.1. Activate Flight 1c

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

56.7.1.1.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.476625Z)

56.7.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver activates the smaller Flight 1c form, which should be done successfully. Note that Flight 1c could be either planned or non-existent before this step. In the latter case, the "user" will directly activate the flight without planning it beforehand.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.476593Z)

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

56.7.2. Attempt to modify activated Flight 1c into conflict test step

56.7.2.1. Attempt to modify Flight 1c

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied modification because of a non-permitted conflict with an equal priority flight intent. See modify_activated_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

56.7.2.1.1. üõë Incorrectly modified check

If the USS successfully modifies the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in modifying the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0050.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.582393Z)

56.7.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to enlarge Flight 1c so that it conflicts with Flight 2. Both flights are activated at the point where that change is requested. However, because the conflict did not exist when the modification was initiated, it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0050. In addition, Flight 1c should not have been removed, because doing so would leave an aircraft in flight without any flight plan.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.582360Z)

56.7.2.2. Validate Flight 1c not modified

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.7.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.519243Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.588780Z)

56.7.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Because the modification attempt was invalid, Flight 1c should not have been modified.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.588835Z)

56.7.3. Delete Flight 1c if USS did not support its modification test step

‚àÖ This test step was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

This page describes the content of a common test case where a flight intent should be successfully deleted by a flight planner. See delete_flight in test_steps.py.

56.7.3.1. üõë Successful deletion check

The flight ID provided is correct and corresponds to an existing flight intent, therefore it should have been deleted by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a failure, this check will fail. If, during the previous step, the USS indicated that it does not support modifications, then it will not be able to modify Flight 1c into Flight 1 during the next test case. As such, the test driver deletes Flight 1c from the system so that Flight 1 can be created directly activated during the next test case.

56.7.4. Delete Flight 2 test step

This page describes the content of a common test case where a flight intent should be successfully deleted by a flight planner. See delete_flight in test_steps.py.

56.7.4.1. üõë Successful deletion check

The flight ID provided is correct and corresponds to an existing flight intent, therefore it should have been deleted by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a failure, this check will fail. To prepare for the next test case, Flight 2 must be removed from the system.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.634274Z)

56.8. Modify activated flight with pre-existing conflict test case

56.8.1. Activate Flight 1 test step

56.8.1.1. Activate Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

56.8.1.1.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.742246Z)

56.8.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver activates the normal form of Flight 1, which should be done successfully since Flight 2 was removed at the end of the previous step. Note that Flight 1 could be either already activated in the smaller Flight 1c form or non-existent before this step. In the former case, Flight 1c is enlarged to its normal size. In the latter case, the flight will be directly activated without being planned beforehand.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.742203Z)

56.8.1.2. Validate Flight 1 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.8.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.641681Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:37.748838Z)

56.8.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.748977Z)

56.8.1.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.749027Z)

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.771996Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.783223Z)

56.8.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The smaller Flight 2 form should be successfully planned by the control USS because it does not conflict with Flight 1.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

56.8.3. Declare Flight 2 non-conforming test step

The test driver instructs the control USS to declare Flight 2 as non-conforming. This makes non-conforming Flight 2 conflict with activated Flight 1 -- this same-priority conflict would not be allowed if Flight 2 were in a nominal state.

Do note that executing this test step requires the control USS to support the CMSA role. As such, if the USS rejects the transition to non-conforming state, it will be assumed that the control USS does not support this role and the test execution will stop without failing.

56.8.3.1. üõë Successful transition to non-conforming state check

All flight intent data provided is correct, therefore it should have been transitioned to non-conforming state by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS rejects the transition, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the operation is not supported, the USS does not support the CMSA role, and as such the scenario execution will stop without failing.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.993957Z)

56.8.3.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:37.993928Z)

56.8.3.3. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

56.8.3.3.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

56.8.4. Attempt to modify activated Flight 1 in conflict with nonconforming Flight 2 test step

‚àÖ This test step was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

Before execution of this step, Flight 1 is activated (onto time range A) and Flight 2 is non-conforming (onto time range A), and both are in conflict. The test driver modifies Flight 1 in a way that still conflicts with Flight 2 by extending its time range A. This modification results in a conflict between the two equal priority flights that already existed before the modification was initiated. While this modification is expected to be accepted by the tested USS in general, the rejection of the modification does not constitute a violation of a requirement. However, the modification request must not result in a failure per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Nor should Flight 1 have been removed, because doing so would leave an aircraft in flight without any flight plan.

56.8.4.1. üõë Successful flight intent handling check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have either:

  • successfully modified the flight; or
  • properly rejected the modification; or
  • indicated that it does not support modification per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. In any other case, this check will fail.
56.8.4.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

56.8.4.3. Validate Flight 1 sharing if USS accepted its modification

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.8.4.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

56.8.4.3.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

56.8.4.3.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

56.8.4.3.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

56.8.4.3.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

56.8.4.3.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

56.8.4.3.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

56.8.4.3.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

56.8.4.3.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

56.8.4.3.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. This step validates that the response of the USS is consistent with the flight shared if the USS accepted the modification, i.e. whether Flight 1 was properly modified.

56.8.4.4. Validate Flight 1 not modified if USS rejected its modification

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

56.8.4.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

56.8.4.4.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. This step validates that the response of the USS is consistent with the flight shared if the USS rejected the modification, i.e. whether Flight 1 was not modified.

56.9. Cleanup

56.9.1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Successful flight deletion check

interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.051196Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.106855Z)

57. [S52] Nominal planning: not permitted conflict with equal priority

57.1. Description

This test aims at testing the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the prioritization scenarios where there exists a conflict with an equal priority flight that is not permitted by regulation:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0035
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0040
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0045
  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0050

It involves a tested USS and a control USS through which conflicting flights are injected.

This scenario skips execution and completes successfully at the setup case if a resource containing equal priority flight intents where conflicts are not allow is not provided, such as if a jurisdiction does not have any priority levels at which conflicts are not allowed.

It assumes that the area used in the scenario is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario).

57.2. Resources

57.2.1. flight_intents

If the jurisdiction in which these tests are being conducted does not have a priority level at which conflicts are not allowed, the FlightIntentsResource must be None to prevent the execution of this test.

Otherwise, the FlightIntentsResource must provide the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Priority State Must conflict with Must not conflict with
flight1_planned Flight 1 Any (but all the same) Accepted Flight 2 N/A
flight1_activated Activated
flight1m_activated Flight 1m Activated Flight 2 N/A
flight1c_planned Flight 1c Planned N/A Flight 2
flight1c_activated Activated
equal_prio_flight2m_planned Flight 2m Planned N/A Flight 1
equal_prio_flight2_planned Flight 2 Flight 1, Flight 1m Flight 1c
equal_prio_flight2_activated Activated
equal_prio_flight2_nonconforming Nonconforming

Because the scenario involves activation of intents, the start times of all activated intents must be during the time the test scenario is executed (not before). Additionally, their end times must leave sufficient time for the execution of the test scenario.

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

57.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 1 and its variants.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

57.2.3. control_uss

FlightPlannerResource that will be used to inject conflicting Flight 2. Note that this control USS needs to support the CMSA role in order to transition to the Nonconforming state in order to create a pre-existing conflict among equal-priority operational intents.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

57.2.4. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where flight creation/sharing can be verified.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

57.3. Prerequisites check test case

57.3.1. Verify area is clear test step

uss_qualifier verifies with the DSS that there are no operational intents remaining in the area.

57.3.1.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, or fails to allow the deletion of an operational intent from its own creator, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.113539Z)

57.3.1.2. üõë Area is clear of op intents check

If operational intents exist in the 4D area(s) that should be clear, then the current state of the test environment is not suitable to conduct tests so this check will fail.

While this scenario assumes that the area used is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario) in order to avoid a large number of area-clearing operations, the scenario will not proceed correctly if the area was left in a dirty state following a previous scenario that was supposed to leave the area clear. This test step verifies that the area is clear.

‚úÖ (2026-02-12T10:53:38.113649Z)

57.4. Attempt to plan flight into conflict test case

57.4.1. Plan Flight 2 test step

57.4.1.1. Plan Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

57.4.1.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.201873Z)

57.4.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 2 should be successfully planned by the control USS.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.201842Z)

57.4.1.2. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

57.4.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.120471Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.206826Z)

57.4.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.206877Z)

57.4.1.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

57.4.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.206916Z)

57.4.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.223521Z)

57.4.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.232565Z)

57.4.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.233552Z)

57.4.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.233585Z)

57.4.1.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.233608Z)

57.4.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

57.4.2. Activate Flight 2 test step

57.4.2.1. Activate Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test step where a valid user flight intent should be successfully activated by a flight planner. See activate_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

57.4.2.1.1. üõë Successful activation check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been activated by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.336334Z)

57.4.2.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 2 should be successfully activated by the control USS.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.336304Z)

57.4.2.2. Validate Flight 2 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

57.4.2.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.240817Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.341406Z)

57.4.2.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.341494Z)

57.4.2.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.341477Z)

57.4.2.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.341524Z)

57.4.2.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.357860Z)

57.4.2.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.366714Z)

57.4.2.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.367750Z)

57.4.2.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.367785Z)

57.4.2.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.367809Z)

57.4.2.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

57.4.3. Attempt to plan Flight 1 test step

57.4.3.1. Attempt to plan Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied planning because of a non-permitted conflict with an equal priority flight intent. See plan_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

57.4.3.1.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

If the USS successfully plans the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in creating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0035.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.434712Z)

57.4.3.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to plan the Flight 1 via the tested USS. However, it conflicts with Flight 2 which is of equal priority but came first. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0035.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.434674Z)

57.4.3.2. Validate Flight 1 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

57.4.3.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.375248Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.440223Z)

57.4.3.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 1 should not have been shared with the interoperability ecosystem since it was rejected.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.440285Z)

57.5. Attempt to activate flight into conflict test case

57.5.1. Attempt to directly activate conflicting Flight 1 test step

57.5.1.1. Attempt to activate Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test step where a user flight intent should be denied activation because of a non-permitted conflict with an equal priority flight intent. See activate_conflict_flight in prioritization_test_steps.py.

57.5.1.1.1. üõë Incorrectly activated check

If the USS successfully activates the flight or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, it means they failed to detect the conflict with the pre-existing flight. Therefore, this check will fail if the USS indicates success in creating the flight from the user flight intent, per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0045.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.505117Z)

57.5.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The test driver attempts to activate directly Flight 1, i.e. without the flight being planned before. However, this conflicts with activated Flight 2, which is of equal priority. As such it should be rejected per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0045.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.505058Z)

57.5.1.2. Validate Flight 1 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

57.5.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.448882Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.509967Z)

57.5.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. Flight 1 should not have been shared with the interoperability ecosystem since it was rejected.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.510010Z)

57.6. Attempt to modify planned flight into conflict test case

57.6.1. Plan Flight 1c test step

57.6.1.1. Plan Flight 1c

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

57.6.1.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.611680Z)

57.6.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. The smaller Flight 1c form (which doesn't conflict with Flight 2) should be successfully planned by the tested USS.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.611650Z)

57.6.1.2. ‚ö†Ô∏è Validate tested USS intersection algorithm check

Because Flight 2 is nearby Flight 1c, successful planning of Flight 1c indicates the tested USS is complying with the portion of astm.f3548.v21.GEN0500 that requires a USS to indicate two 4D volumes are non-intersecting when they are separated by more than 1 cm.

This check is not relevant if the planning is rejected.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.611711Z)

57.6.1.3. Validate Flight 1c sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

57.6.1.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.516906Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:53:38.616992Z)

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:53:38.617046Z)
