60.4.2. Validate Flight 2 notification received by tested_uss test step

This step verifies that a Tested USS successfully received a notification about a relevant operational intent from a Mock USS instance. This is done by checking the interactions of that Mock USS instance.

60.4.2.1. Get Mock USS interactions logs

This step obtains interactions of interest from mock_uss.

60.4.2.1.1. üõë Mock USS interactions logs retrievable check

The Mock USSes provide a GET endpoint to retrieve all the interactions that took place between them and other USSes after a particular time. If there is any error retrieving these interactions, this check will fail as per interuss.mock_uss.hosted_instance.ExposeInterface. Mock USS provides a GET endpoint to retrieve all the interactions that took place between Mock USS and other USSes after a particular time. These interactions also include the notifications sent and received by Mock USS.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.393731Z)

60.4.2.2. üõë Mock USS sends valid notification check

There is an assumption here that DSS shared the correct subscriber information with Mock USS in response to planning or modifying its operational intent.

As per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005, Mock USS should send valid notification to USSes subscribed in the area. The validation of notification involves checking that Mock USS included the correct subscription_id in the notification. The check will fail if no or more than one notification is sent to the tested USS, or if the notification does not include the expected subscription_id.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.393803Z)

60.4.2.3. ‚ö†Ô∏è Tested USS receives valid notification check

USSes shall maintain awareness of operational intents relevant to their own ones when they are in the Activated, NonConforming or Contingent states. In DSS, there is a subscription associated with an operational intent managed by a USS. A tested USS should successfully receive a notification of relevant intent from Mock USS based on this subscription.

If the tested USS does not respond with an HTTP status 204 to a valid notification sent by the mock USS, then the tested USS does not maintain awareness of operational intents relevant to their own ones (astm.f3548.v21.SCD0080), and does not implement correctly the notifyOperationalIntentDetailsChanged operation (astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,3).

Check a notification was received by tested_uss for Flight 2, with Flight 1's subscription_id, after modification of the flight.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.393835Z)

60.5. Declare Operational intent non-conforming and receive notification of relevant intent test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

60.5.1. ToDo

60.6. Declare Operational intent contingent and receive notification of relevant intent test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

60.6.1. ToDo

60.7. Cleanup

60.7.1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Successful flight deletion check

The flights are cleaned up at the end of the test scenario. interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.432425Z)

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.468935Z)

61. [S56] Awareness of relevant operational intents

61.1. Description

When a USS submits an operational intent to DSS, a subscription is associated with that operational intent in DSS. This subscription can be either an implicit or explicit subscription that covers the area of the operational intent. The subscription helps the USS to be notified of new or modified operations in the area, when its operational intent is in Activated, NonConforming and Contingent states. In this scenario, we will verify that USS under test has a subscription to cover the operational intent area, and receives relevant notifications from other USSes.

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0080

This scenario assumes that the area used in the scenario is already clear of any pre-existing flights (using, for instance, PrepareFlightPlanners scenario).

61.2. Resources

61.2.1. flight_intents

FlightIntentsResource that provides the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name State Must be relevant, but not intersecting
flight_1_planned Flight 1 Accepted Flight 2
flight_1_activated Activated
flight_2_planned Flight 2 Accepted Flight 1
flight_2_planned_modified

To reach a situation where Flight 1 and Flight 2 do not intersect but are relevant to each other:

  • their time ranges and altitudes do intersect;
  • their geometries do not intersect, but their convex hulls do.

Because the scenario involves activation of intents, all activated intents must be active during the execution of the test scenario. Additionally, their end time must leave sufficient time for the execution of the test scenario. For the sake of simplicity, it is recommended to set the start and end times of all the intents to the same range.

‚úÖ Provided by non_conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

61.2.2. mock_uss

MockUSSResource will be used for planning flights in order to send notifications to tested_uss, and gathering interuss interactions from mock_uss.

‚úÖ Provided by mock_uss in top-level resource pool.

61.2.3. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that will be used for the USS being tested for its ability to maintain awareness of operational intent.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

61.2.4. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where flight creation/sharing can be verified.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

61.3. Activated operational intent receives notification of relevant intent test case

This test case verifies that relevant notifications for new operational intents are received through subscription of an operational intent in Activated state.

61.3.1. Tested_uss plans and activates Flight 1 test step

61.3.1.1. Plan Flight 1

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent should be successfully planned by a flight planner. See plan_flight_intent in test_steps.py.

61.3.1.1.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been planned by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS indicates a conflict, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the flight was rejected, this check will fail. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.584179Z)

61.3.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

Flight 1 should be successfully planned by tested_uss.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.584147Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.726013Z)

61.3.1.2. Validate Flight 1 sharing

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

61.3.1.2.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.480030Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.589337Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.622799Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.731340Z)

61.3.1.2.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.589415Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.731436Z)

61.3.1.2.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.731418Z)

61.3.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.589462Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.731471Z)

61.3.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.607071Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.748614Z)

61.3.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.616436Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.757156Z)

61.3.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.617511Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.758160Z)

61.3.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.617552Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.758200Z)

61.3.1.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.617581Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:09.758227Z)

61.3.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

This step verifies that a Tested USS successfully received a notification about a relevant operational intent from a Mock USS instance. This is done by checking the interactions of that Mock USS instance.

This step obtains interactions of interest from mock_uss.

61.3.3.1.1. üõë Mock USS interactions logs retrievable check

The Mock USSes provide a GET endpoint to retrieve all the interactions that took place between them and other USSes after a particular time. If there is any error retrieving these interactions, this check will fail as per interuss.mock_uss.hosted_instance.ExposeInterface. Mock USS provides a GET endpoint to retrieve all the interactions that took place between Mock USS and other USSes after a particular time. These interactions also include the notifications sent and received by Mock USS.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.904276Z)

61.3.3.2. üõë Mock USS sends valid notification check

There is an assumption here that DSS shared the correct subscriber information with Mock USS in response to planning or modifying its operational intent.

As per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005, Mock USS should send valid notification to USSes subscribed in the area. The validation of notification involves checking that Mock USS included the correct subscription_id in the notification. The check will fail if no or more than one notification is sent to the tested USS, or if the notification does not include the expected subscription_id.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:09.904351Z)

61.3.3.3. ‚ö†Ô∏è Tested USS receives valid notification check

USSes shall maintain awareness of operational intents relevant to their own ones when they are in the Activated, NonConforming or Contingent states. In DSS, there is a subscription associated with an operational intent managed by a USS. A tested USS should successfully receive a notification of relevant intent from Mock USS based on this subscription.

If the tested USS does not respond with an HTTP status 204 to a valid notification sent by the mock USS, then the tested USS does not maintain awareness of operational intents relevant to their own ones (astm.f3548.v21.SCD0080), and does not implement correctly the notifyOperationalIntentDetailsChanged operation (astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,3).

61.4. Modify Activated operational intent area and receive notification of relevant intent test case

This test case verifies that relevant notifications for modified operational intents are received through subscription of an operational intent in Activated state.

61.4.1. Mock_uss modifies planned Flight 2 test step

61.4.1.1. Modify Flight 2

This page describes the content of a common test case where a valid user flight intent in planned state should be successfully modified by a flight planner. See modify_planned_flight in test_steps.py.

61.4.1.1.1. üõë Successful modification check

All flight intent data provided is correct and valid and free of conflict in space and time, therefore it should have been modified by the USS per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the USS fails to modify the flight, wrongly indicates a conflict, or wrongly indicates the planned state of the flight, this check will fail.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.011579Z)

61.4.1.1.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept the flight. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

The test driver successfully modifies planned Flight 2 via the mock uss, as there is still no conflict with Flight 1. However, because they are relevant to each other mock_uss will send Flight 2 notification to tested_uss.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.011547Z)

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

61.4.1.2.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.018106Z)

61.4.1.2.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.032281Z)

61.4.1.2.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.041148Z)

61.4.1.2.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.042204Z)

61.4.1.2.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.042240Z)

61.4.1.2.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.042265Z)

61.4.1.2.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

61.4.2. Validate Flight 2 notification received by tested_uss test step

This step verifies that a Tested USS successfully received a notification about a relevant operational intent from a Mock USS instance. This is done by checking the interactions of that Mock USS instance.

61.4.2.1. Get Mock USS interactions logs

This step obtains interactions of interest from mock_uss.

61.4.2.1.1. üõë Mock USS interactions logs retrievable check

The Mock USSes provide a GET endpoint to retrieve all the interactions that took place between them and other USSes after a particular time. If there is any error retrieving these interactions, this check will fail as per interuss.mock_uss.hosted_instance.ExposeInterface. Mock USS provides a GET endpoint to retrieve all the interactions that took place between Mock USS and other USSes after a particular time. These interactions also include the notifications sent and received by Mock USS.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.053889Z)

61.4.2.2. üõë Mock USS sends valid notification check

There is an assumption here that DSS shared the correct subscriber information with Mock USS in response to planning or modifying its operational intent.

As per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005, Mock USS should send valid notification to USSes subscribed in the area. The validation of notification involves checking that Mock USS included the correct subscription_id in the notification. The check will fail if no or more than one notification is sent to the tested USS, or if the notification does not include the expected subscription_id.

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.053974Z)

61.4.2.3. ‚ö†Ô∏è Tested USS receives valid notification check

USSes shall maintain awareness of operational intents relevant to their own ones when they are in the Activated, NonConforming or Contingent states. In DSS, there is a subscription associated with an operational intent managed by a USS. A tested USS should successfully receive a notification of relevant intent from Mock USS based on this subscription.

If the tested USS does not respond with an HTTP status 204 to a valid notification sent by the mock USS, then the tested USS does not maintain awareness of operational intents relevant to their own ones (astm.f3548.v21.SCD0080), and does not implement correctly the notifyOperationalIntentDetailsChanged operation (astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,3).

Check a notification was received by tested_uss for Flight 2, with Flight 1's subscription_id, after modification of the flight.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.054013Z)

61.5. Declare Operational intent non-conforming and receive notification of relevant intent test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

61.5.1. ToDo

61.6. Declare Operational intent contingent and receive notification of relevant intent test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

61.6.1. ToDo

61.7. Cleanup

61.7.1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Successful flight deletion check

The flights are cleaned up at the end of the test scenario. interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ mock_uss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.097702Z)

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.136422Z)

62. [S57] Off-Nominal planning: down USS

62.1. Description

This test aims to test the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the down USS mechanism in the general case:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005

It involves a single tested USS. The USS qualifier acts as a virtual USS that may have its availability set to down.

62.2. Resources

62.2.1. flight_intents

FlightIntentsResource that provides the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Usage State UAS State
flight1_planned Flight 1 Planned Nominal

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

62.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 1.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 1 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

62.2.3. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where:

  • flight creation/sharing can be verified,
  • the USS qualifier acting as a virtual USS can create operational intent references, and
  • the USS qualifier can act as an availability arbitrator.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

62.3. Setup test case

62.3.1. Resolve USS ID of virtual USS test step

Make a dummy request to the DSS in order to resolve the USS ID of the virtual USS.

62.3.1.1. üõë Successful dummy query check

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.142028Z)

62.3.2. Restore virtual USS availability test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

62.3.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

62.3.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.145030Z)

62.3.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

62.3.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.149994Z)

62.3.3. Clear operational intents created by virtual USS test step

Delete any leftover operational intent references created at DSS by virtual USS.

62.3.3.1. üõë Successful operational intents cleanup check

If the search for operational intent references or their deletion fail, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1, respectively.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.153710Z)

62.3.4. Verify area is clear test step

uss_qualifier verifies with the DSS that there are no operational intents remaining in the area.

62.3.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, or fails to allow the deletion of an operational intent from its own creator, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.157241Z)

62.3.4.2. üõë Area is clear of op intents check

If operational intents exist in the 4D area(s) that should be clear, then the current state of the test environment is not suitable to conduct tests so this check will fail.

This scenario requires the area to have been cleared of operational intents. If it has not, this test step will raise a failed check.

‚úÖ (2026-02-12T10:54:10.157319Z)

62.4. Plan Flight 1 in conflict with accepted operational intent managed by down USS test case

This test case aims at testing requirement astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005.

62.4.1. Virtual USS creates conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, creates an operational intent at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

62.4.1.1. üõë Operational intent successfully created check

If the creation of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.173256Z)

62.4.2. Declare virtual USS as down at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Down' at the DSS.

See set_uss_down in test_steps.py.

62.4.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

62.4.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.176329Z)

62.4.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

62.4.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.181721Z)

62.4.3. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 1 test step

Flight 1 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Accepted' state, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the lowest bound priority status, i.e. a priority strictly lower than the lowest priority allowed by the local regulation.

As such, the tested USS may either:

  • Successfully plan Flight 1 over the conflicting operational intent, or
  • Decide to be more conservative and reject the planning of Flight 1.
62.4.3.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have either successfully planned Flight 1 per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005, or rejected properly the planning if it decided to be more conservative with such conflicts. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

Do take note that if the USS rejects the planning, this check will not fail, but the following Rejected planning check will. Refer to this check for more information.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.291252Z)

62.4.3.2. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Rejected planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have either successfully planned Flight 1 or rejected properly the planning if it decided to be more conservative with such conflicts. If the USS rejects the planning, this check will produce a low severity finding per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

62.4.3.3. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 1. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.291221Z)

62.4.3.4. Validate accepted Flight 1 status

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

62.4.3.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.186795Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.297275Z)

62.4.3.4.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.297333Z)

62.4.3.4.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

62.4.3.4.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.297375Z)

62.4.3.4.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.317281Z)

62.4.3.4.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.326593Z)

62.4.3.4.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.327611Z)

62.4.3.4.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.327650Z)

62.4.3.4.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.327676Z)

62.4.3.4.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. If the planning was accepted, Flight 1 should have been shared.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

62.4.3.5. Validate rejected Flight 1 status

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

62.4.3.5.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.186795Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.297275Z)

62.4.3.5.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the planning was rejected, Flight 1 should not have been shared, thus should not exist.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

62.5. Cleanup

62.5.1. Restore virtual USS availability test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

62.5.1.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

62.5.1.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.330868Z)

62.5.1.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

62.5.1.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.335730Z)

62.5.2. üõë Successful flight deletion check

Delete flights injected at USS through the flight planning interface. interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.378847Z)

62.5.3. üõë Successful operational intents cleanup check

Delete operational intents created at DSS by virtual USS. If the search for operational intent references or their deletion fail, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1, respectively.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.395829Z)

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005

63.4.3. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 1 test step

Flight 1 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Accepted' state, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the lowest bound priority status, i.e. a priority strictly lower than the lowest priority allowed by the local regulation.

As such, the tested USS may either:

  • Successfully plan Flight 1 over the conflicting operational intent, or
  • Decide to be more conservative and reject the planning of Flight 1.
63.4.3.1. üõë Successful planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have either successfully planned Flight 1 per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005, or rejected properly the planning if it decided to be more conservative with such conflicts. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail.

Do take note that if the USS rejects the planning, this check will not fail, but the following Rejected planning check will. Refer to this check for more information.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.546264Z)

63.4.3.2. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Rejected planning check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have either successfully planned Flight 1 or rejected properly the planning if it decided to be more conservative with such conflicts. If the USS rejects the planning, this check will produce a low severity finding per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0005.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

63.4.3.3. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 1. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.546232Z)

63.4.3.4. Validate accepted Flight 1 status

This step verifies that a created flight is shared properly per ASTM F3548-21 by querying the DSS for flights in the area of the flight intent, and then retrieving the details from the USS if the operational intent reference is found. See OpIntentValidator.expect_shared() in test_steps.py.

63.4.3.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to properly respond to a valid search query for operational intents in an area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.445773Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.552384Z)

63.4.3.4.2. üõë Operational intent shared correctly check

If a reference to the operational intent for the flight is not found in the DSS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0005 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.552445Z)

63.4.3.4.3. üõë Operational intent for active flight not deleted check

If an activated operational intent is expected to exist after it has been modified or activated and that it is not found in the DSS, this means that there is an active flight without a corresponding operational intent, then this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.FlightCoveredByOperationalIntent.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

63.4.3.4.4. üõë Operational intent state is correct check

If the state of the operational intent found in the DSS does not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.552488Z)

63.4.3.4.5. üõë Operational intent details retrievable check

If the operational intent details for the flight cannot be retrieved from the USS, this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1 and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.571494Z)

63.4.3.4.6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Operational intent details data format check

If the operational intent details response does not validate against the GetOperationalIntentDetailsResponse schema of the OpenAPI specification, this check fill fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,1.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.580576Z)

63.4.3.4.7. üõë Correct operational intent details check

If the operational intent details reported by the USS do not match the user's flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior and astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0025.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.581636Z)

63.4.3.4.8. ‚ö†Ô∏è Off-nominal volumes check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0015 specifies that nominal operational intents (Accepted and Activated) must not include any off-nominal 4D volumes, so this check will fail if an Accepted or Activated operational intent includes off-nominal volumes.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.581671Z)

63.4.3.4.9. ‚ö†Ô∏è Vertices check

astm.f3548.v21.OPIN0020

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.581697Z)

63.4.3.4.10. üõë Operational intent telemetry retrievable check

If:

  • the operational intent is in an off-nominal state,
  • that its telemetry cannot be retrieved from the USS, and
  • that the USS does not explicitly indicate that no telemetry is available,

this check will fail per astm.f3548.v21.USS0105,2. If the planning was accepted, Flight 1 should have been shared.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

63.4.3.5. Validate rejected Flight 1 status

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

63.4.3.5.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.445773Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.552384Z)

63.4.3.5.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior. If the planning was rejected, Flight 1 should not have been shared, thus should not exist.

‚àÖ This check was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

63.5. Cleanup

63.5.1. Restore virtual USS availability test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

63.5.1.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

63.5.1.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.584709Z)

63.5.1.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

63.5.1.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.589416Z)

63.5.2. üõë Successful flight deletion check

Delete flights injected at USS through the flight planning interface. interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.DeleteFlightSuccess

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.628014Z)

63.5.3. üõë Successful operational intents cleanup check

Delete operational intents created at DSS by virtual USS. If the search for operational intent references or their deletion fail, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1, respectively.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.644576Z)

64. [S59] Off-Nominal planning: down USS with equal priority conflicts not permitted

64.1. Description

This test aims to test the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the down USS mechanism in the case where equal priority conflicts are not permitted:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010

It involves a single tested USS. The USS qualifier acts as a virtual USS that may have its availability set to down.

64.2. Resources

64.2.1. flight_intents

FlightIntentsResource that provides the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Priority Usage State UAS State
flight2_planned Flight 2 Any level where conflicts are not permitted Planned Nominal

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

64.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 2.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 1 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

64.2.3. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where:

  • flight creation/sharing can be verified,
  • the USS qualifier acting as a virtual USS can create operational intents, and
  • the USS qualifier can act as an availability arbitrator.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

64.3. Setup test case

64.3.1. Resolve USS ID of virtual USS test step

Make a dummy request to the DSS in order to resolve the USS ID of the virtual USS.

64.3.1.1. üõë Successful dummy query check

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.650889Z)

64.3.2. Restore virtual USS availability test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

64.3.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.3.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.653479Z)

64.3.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.3.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.657729Z)

64.3.3. Clear operational intents created by virtual USS test step

Delete any leftover operational intents created at DSS by virtual USS.

64.3.3.1. üõë Successful operational intents cleanup check

If the search for operational intent references or their deletion fail, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1, respectively.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.661035Z)

64.3.4. Verify area is clear test step

uss_qualifier verifies with the DSS that there are no operational intents remaining in the area.

64.3.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, or fails to allow the deletion of an operational intent from its own creator, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.664390Z)

64.3.4.2. üõë Area is clear of op intents check

If operational intents exist in the 4D area(s) that should be clear, then the current state of the test environment is not suitable to conduct tests so this check will fail.

This scenario requires the area to have been cleared of operational intents. If it has not, this test step will raise a failed check.

‚úÖ (2026-02-12T10:54:10.664462Z)

64.4. Plan Flight 2 in conflict with activated operational intent managed by down USS test case

This test case aims at testing requirement astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010 when the pre-existing conflicting flight is in the Activated state.

64.4.1. Virtual USS creates conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, creates an operational intent with identical characteristics to Flight 2 at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

64.4.1.1. üõë Operational intent successfully created check

If the creation of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.680100Z)

64.4.2. Virtual USS activates conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, activates the operational intent previously created at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

64.4.2.1. üõë Operational intent successfully activated check

If the activation of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.699663Z)

64.4.3. Declare virtual USS as down at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Down' at the DSS.

See set_uss_down in test_steps.py.

64.4.3.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.4.3.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.702375Z)

64.4.3.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.4.3.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.707024Z)

64.4.4. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 2 test step

The same-priority Flight 2 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Activated' state,
  • the local regulation does not allow for equal priority conflicts at this priority level, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the highest priority status allowed by the local regulation. As such, the tested USS should reject the planning of Flight 2.
64.4.4.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have properly rejected the planning per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail. If the USS successfully plans Flight 2 or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.768293Z)

64.4.4.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 2. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.768261Z)

64.4.4.3. Validate Flight 2 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

64.4.4.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.711785Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.773150Z)

64.4.4.3.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss1_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.773196Z)

64.4.5. Restore virtual USS availability at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

64.4.5.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.4.5.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.779850Z)

64.5. Plan Flight 2 in conflict with nonconforming operational intent managed by down USS test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

This test case aims at testing requirement astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010 when the pre-existing conflicting flight is in the Nonconforming state. This test case will only be executed if uss_qualifier can perform Conformance Monitoring for Situational Awareness operations in the provided DSS instance.

64.5.1. Virtual USS transitions to Nonconforming conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, transitions to Nonconforming the operational intent previously created at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

64.5.1.1. üõë Operational intent successfully transitioned to Nonconforming check

If the transition of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

64.5.2. Declare virtual USS as down at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Down' at the DSS.

See set_uss_down in test_steps.py.

64.5.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.5.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

64.5.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.5.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

64.5.3. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 2 test step

The same-priority Flight 2 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Nonconforming' state,
  • the local regulation does not allow for equal priority conflicts at this priority level, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the highest priority status allowed by the local regulation. As such, the tested USS should reject the planning of Flight 2.
64.5.3.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have rejected properly the planning per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail. If the USS successfully plans Flight 2 or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, this check will fail.

64.5.3.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 2. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

64.5.3.3. Validate Flight 2 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

64.5.3.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

64.5.3.3.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

64.5.4. Restore virtual USS availability at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

64.5.4.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.5.4.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

64.5.4.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

64.5.4.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Contingent' state,
  • the local regulation does not allow for equal priority conflicts at this priority level, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the highest priority status allowed by the local regulation. As such, the tested USS should reject the planning of Flight 2.
64.6.3.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have rejected properly the planning per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail. If the USS successfully plans Flight 2 or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, this check will fail.

64.6.3.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 2. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

64.6.3.3. Validate Flight 2 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

64.6.3.3.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

65. [S60] Off-Nominal planning: down USS with equal priority conflicts not permitted

65.1. Description

This test aims to test the strategic coordination requirements that relate to the down USS mechanism in the case where equal priority conflicts are not permitted:

  • astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010

It involves a single tested USS. The USS qualifier acts as a virtual USS that may have its availability set to down.

65.2. Resources

65.2.1. flight_intents

FlightIntentsResource that provides the following flight intents:

Flight intent ID Flight name Priority Usage State UAS State
flight2_planned Flight 2 Any level where conflicts are not permitted Planned Nominal

‚úÖ Provided by conflicting_flights in top-level resource pool.

65.2.2. tested_uss

FlightPlannerResource that is under test and will manage Flight 2.

‚úÖ Provided by instance 2 in flight_planners in top-level resource pool.

65.2.3. dss

DSSInstanceResource that provides access to a DSS instance where:

  • flight creation/sharing can be verified,
  • the USS qualifier acting as a virtual USS can create operational intents, and
  • the USS qualifier can act as an availability arbitrator.

‚úÖ Provided by dss in top-level resource pool.

65.3. Setup test case

65.3.1. Resolve USS ID of virtual USS test step

Make a dummy request to the DSS in order to resolve the USS ID of the virtual USS.

65.3.1.1. üõë Successful dummy query check

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.808259Z)

65.3.2. Restore virtual USS availability test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

65.3.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.3.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.810706Z)

65.3.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.3.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.814801Z)

65.3.3. Clear operational intents created by virtual USS test step

Delete any leftover operational intents created at DSS by virtual USS.

65.3.3.1. üõë Successful operational intents cleanup check

If the search for operational intent references or their deletion fail, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1, respectively.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.818073Z)

65.3.4. Verify area is clear test step

uss_qualifier verifies with the DSS that there are no operational intents remaining in the area.

65.3.4.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, or fails to allow the deletion of an operational intent from its own creator, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1 or astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.821399Z)

65.3.4.2. üõë Area is clear of op intents check

If operational intents exist in the 4D area(s) that should be clear, then the current state of the test environment is not suitable to conduct tests so this check will fail.

This scenario requires the area to have been cleared of operational intents. If it has not, this test step will raise a failed check.

‚úÖ (2026-02-12T10:54:10.821470Z)

65.4. Plan Flight 2 in conflict with activated operational intent managed by down USS test case

This test case aims at testing requirement astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010 when the pre-existing conflicting flight is in the Activated state.

65.4.1. Virtual USS creates conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, creates an operational intent with identical characteristics to Flight 2 at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

65.4.1.1. üõë Operational intent successfully created check

If the creation of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.836737Z)

65.4.2. Virtual USS activates conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, activates the operational intent previously created at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

65.4.2.1. üõë Operational intent successfully activated check

If the activation of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.858009Z)

65.4.3. Declare virtual USS as down at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Down' at the DSS.

See set_uss_down in test_steps.py.

65.4.3.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.4.3.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.860720Z)

65.4.3.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.4.3.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.866044Z)

65.4.4. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 2 test step

The same-priority Flight 2 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Activated' state,
  • the local regulation does not allow for equal priority conflicts at this priority level, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the highest priority status allowed by the local regulation. As such, the tested USS should reject the planning of Flight 2.
65.4.4.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have properly rejected the planning per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail. If the USS successfully plans Flight 2 or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.938839Z)

65.4.4.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 2. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.938808Z)

65.4.4.3. Validate Flight 2 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

65.4.4.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.871649Z)

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.943773Z)

65.4.4.3.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

‚úÖ uss2_core (2026-02-12T10:54:10.943823Z)

65.4.5. Restore virtual USS availability at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

65.4.5.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.4.5.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.946379Z)

65.4.5.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.4.5.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

‚úÖ uss1_dss (2026-02-12T10:54:10.951039Z)

65.5. Plan Flight 2 in conflict with nonconforming operational intent managed by down USS test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

This test case aims at testing requirement astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010 when the pre-existing conflicting flight is in the Nonconforming state. This test case will only be executed if uss_qualifier can perform Conformance Monitoring for Situational Awareness operations in the provided DSS instance.

65.5.1. Virtual USS transitions to Nonconforming conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, transitions to Nonconforming the operational intent previously created at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

65.5.1.1. üõë Operational intent successfully transitioned to Nonconforming check

If the transition of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

65.5.2. Declare virtual USS as down at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Down' at the DSS.

See set_uss_down in test_steps.py.

65.5.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.5.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

65.5.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.5.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

65.5.3. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 2 test step

The same-priority Flight 2 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Nonconforming' state,
  • the local regulation does not allow for equal priority conflicts at this priority level, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the highest priority status allowed by the local regulation. As such, the tested USS should reject the planning of Flight 2.
65.5.3.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have rejected properly the planning per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail. If the USS successfully plans Flight 2 or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, this check will fail.

65.5.3.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 2. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

65.5.3.3. Validate Flight 2 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

65.5.3.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

65.5.3.3.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

65.5.4. Restore virtual USS availability at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Available' at the DSS.

See set_uss_available in test_steps.py.

65.5.4.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.5.4.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

65.5.4.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.5.4.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

65.6. Plan Flight 2 in conflict with contingent operational intent managed by down USS test case

‚àÖ This test case was not applicable to this test run and is therefore not statused.

This test case aims at testing requirement astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010 when the pre-existing conflicting flight is in the Contingent state. This test case will only be executed if uss_qualifier can perform Conformance Monitoring for Situational Awareness operations in the provided DSS instance.

65.6.1. Virtual USS transitions to Contingent conflicting operational intent test step

The USS qualifier, acting as a virtual USS, transitions to Contingent the operational intent previously created at the DSS with a non-working base URL. The objective is to make the later request by the tested USS to retrieve operational intent details to fail.

65.6.1.1. üõë Operational intent successfully transitioned to Contingent check

If the transition of the operational intent reference at the DSS fails, this check fails per astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,1.

65.6.2. Declare virtual USS as down at DSS test step

This step sets the USS availability to 'Down' at the DSS.

See set_uss_down in test_steps.py.

65.6.2.1. Availability can be read

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.6.2.1.1. üõë USS Availability can be requested check

If, when queried for the availability of a USS using valid credentials, the DSS does not return a valid 200 response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

65.6.2.2. Availability can be updated

This fragment contains the steps for the USS Availability synchronization scenario where we confirm that a USS availability can be correctly read from a DSS instance

65.6.2.2.1. üõë USS Availability can be updated check

If, when presented with a valid query to update the availability state of a USS, a DSS responds with anything else than a 200 OK response, it is in violation of the OpenAPI specification referenced by astm.f3548.v21.DSS0100,1.

65.6.3. Tested USS attempts to plan Flight 2 test step

The same-priority Flight 2 of the tested USS conflicts with the operational intent of the virtual USS. However, since:

  • the virtual USS is declared as down at the DSS,
  • it does not respond for operational intent details, and
  • the conflicting operational intent is in the 'Contingent' state,
  • the local regulation does not allow for equal priority conflicts at this priority level, The tested USS should evaluate the conflicting operational intent as having the highest priority status allowed by the local regulation. As such, the tested USS should reject the planning of Flight 2.
65.6.3.1. üõë Incorrectly planned check

All flight intent data provided is correct and the USS should have rejected properly the planning per astm.f3548.v21.SCD0010. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail. If the USS successfully plans Flight 2 or otherwise fails to indicate a conflict, this check will fail.

65.6.3.2. üõë Failure check

All flight intent data provided was complete and correct. It should have been processed successfully, allowing the USS to reject or accept Flight 2. If the USS indicates that the injection attempt failed, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.

65.6.3.3. Validate Flight 2 not shared

This step verifies that a previous attempt to create a flight did not result in a flight being shared with the DSS. It does so by querying the DSS for operational intents in the area of the flight before and after an attempted creation. This assumes an area lock on the extent of the flight intent.

See OpIntentValidator.expect_not_shared() in test_steps.py.

65.6.3.3.1. üõë DSS responses check

If the DSS fails to reply to a query concerning operational intent references in a given area, it is in violation of astm.f3548.v21.DSS0005,2, and this check will fail.

65.6.3.3.2. üõë Operational intent not shared check

If there are new operational intent references in the area of the flight intent, this check will fail per interuss.automated_testing.flight_planning.ExpectedBehavior.
